director.name: 沃林顿·哈德林 Warrington Hudlin

this_title: Black at Yale: A Film Diary
introduction: The film was directed by Hudlin while he was a Yale College senior, and focuses on the experiences of African-American students at Yale in the early 1970s. The influential documentary short follows students Erroll McDonald and Eugene Rivers, and features a conversation with civil rights activist Stokely Carmichael.
chinese_title: Black at Yale: A Film Diary
